Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 21:33 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers carried out repairs to a fault on the underground network in the Archway Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

If you haven't already, please layer up in warm clothes or blankets and avoid opening doors and windows. It is also advised to stay in the same room where possible with the door closed to retain the heat.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on asap.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 19:39 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 23:22 - We can now confirm that all power in the Ottershaw Park  area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 22:25 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Ottershaw Park area, the estimated time of 00:30-01:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Sent by Luke at 22:25 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Ottershaw Park  area, the estimated time of 00:30-01:30 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Talie at 21:56.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 07:01 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 07:45. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Will at 10:32 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 164 customers in the Horsham, RH13 0 and 9 area, by diverting power away from some faulty overhead network equipment. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Our engineers have come across some faulty equipment on the overhead network and are planning to make a cut on some cabling which will isolate this equipment and then allow them to divert power away from this section and restore supplies.

At this stage we don't need to change the estimated time frame and I will continue to keep you updated with their progress. 

If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 105. Sent at 10:28 by Will.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 09:37 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the PE6 0 area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 13:00 and 14:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Will from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 09:04 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 14 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 13:00 and 14:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Theo at 10:11 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 971 properties.

However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 695 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment.

We're currently estimating power will be on between 11:30-12:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find.

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect.
